title: Configure a remote UCMDB
content:
Your Universal Discovery and CMDB (UD/UCMDB) is the database where you manage device information. If you are a Service Asset and Configuration Management administrator, follow these steps to configure an external UCMDB.

To configure a remote UCMDB:

  1. Make sure that you have already set up an integration of Service Management with the remote UCMDB Server. For details, see Related topics.
  2. If the Service Manaement to UCMDB integration is through OPB, make sure that you have already set up synchronization with the remote UCMDB Server. For details, see Related topics. Alternatively, if Native SACM is active, data synchronization is completed by the system automatically.
  3. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.
  4. Click the SACM configuration link in the upper right corner. Service Management displays a pop-up window.
  5. To permit users to generate a remote desktop connection from Service Management, select the Enable RDP check box. When you select this option, Service Management displays a Remote Connection button at the top of each form.
  6. To permit users to navigate to an external UCMDB through UCMDB browser, add the UCMDB host domain to authorized domain and select the Enable UCMDB browser check box.  
    1. Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings and add the UCMDB host domain to the Authorized domains for navigation field. Examples:
      • If the hostname is myhost.example.com, add "example.com" as an authorized domain.
      • If the hostname is myhost.subdomain.example.com, add "subdomain.example.com" as an authorized domain.
      See Authorized domains for navigation for details.
    2. Select the Enable UCMDB browser check box and you are prompted to enter the location of the external UCMDB in the UCMDB browser URL text box. The UCMDB Browser URL resembles https://<UCMDB_Server_Host>:<UCMDB_Server_Port>/ucmdb-browser. You don't need to specify the UCMDB customer ID, when a user tries to open the UCMDB Browser in Service Management, a corresponding customer ID will be automatically appended to the URL.

      Note: After you specify a valid UCMDB browser location, Service Management will display an Explore button at the top of each SACM record page. Then, an item called UCMDB UI will appear on the SACM menu, by clicking it, you are able to use the UCMDB browser in the Service Management user interface. If you try to open the UCMDB Browser by entering the URL in a web browser, you must manually append the UCMDB customer ID to the URL if multi-customer is enabled in UCMDB. For example, https://<UCMDB_Server_Host>:<UCMDB_Server_Port>/ucmdb-browser?customerID=xxxxxxxxx.

  7. Click Save. When you configure these settings, they apply to all users.

The configuration settings take effect as soon as Service Management refreshes the settings cache. You might experience a delay of up to an hour before the cache is refreshed.

Note: The Download modeling template link on the SACM configuration page enables you to download a modeling template package, which contains modeling templates. When using the Assisted Modeling feature in the UCMDB browser to define service models that will be pushed to Service Management, you must use one of these templates. Otherwise, relationships may be defined in the models that don't meet the integration TQLs and therefore will not be pushed to Service Management.

Once you have set up automatic or custom synchronization with the remote UCMDB Server, these modeling templates are already available in the UCMDB browser. If they aren't, you can click the Download modeling template link to download the modeling template package, save the package locally and deploy it in the UCMDB Package Manager.
